required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Of Pregabalin (Lyrica) In Patients With Painful Diabetic Peripheral Neuropathy
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3b Multicenter, Double-Blind, Efficacy And Safety Study Of Pregabalin In The Treatment Of Patients With Inadequately Treated Painful Diabetic Peripheral Neuropathy

brief_summary.textblock: Patients will be switched from their current medication for painful diabetic peripheral neuropathy to evaluate the safety and efficacy of pregabalin as compared to placebo. All patients will receive pregabalin, and half of patients will receive placebo at some point during the study.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Single-Blind Baseline in Mean Pain Score at Week 19 During Double-Blind Phase
primary_outcome.description: Mean pain score was defined as the mean of the last 7 daily diary pain ratings. Participants rated their DPN pain over the past 24 hours on an 11-point numeric rating scale ranging from 0 = no pain to 10 = worst possible pain. A rating of 1-3 was considered as mild pain; 4-6 = moderate pain; and 7-10 = severe pain. SB baseline refers to the last 7 pain diary entries up to and including Day 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Loss of Pain Response (Double-Blind Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: Time to loss of pain response (based on the daily pain diary data) during the DB treatment phase was analyzed using survival analysis technique. Loss of pain response was defined as less than (<) 15% pain response relative to the SB baseline. SB baseline refers to the last 7 pain diary entries up to and including Day 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Single-Blind Baseline in Mean Pain Score at Week 6 During Single-Blind Phase
secondary_outcome.description: Mean pain score was defined as the mean of the last 7 daily diary pain ratings. Participants rated their DPN pain over the past 24 hours on an 11-point numeric rating scale ranging from 0 = no pain to 10 = worst possible pain. A rating of 1-3 was considered as mild pain; 4-6 = moderate pain; and 7-10 = severe pain. SB baseline refers to the last 7 pain diary entries up to and including Day 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Weekly Mean Pain Scores (Single-Blind Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: Weekly mean pain score was defined as the mean of the daily diary pain ratings split into 7 day intervals. Participants rated their DPN pain over the past 24 hours on an 11-point numeric rating scale ranging from 0 = no pain to 10 = worst possible pain. A rating of 1-3 was considered as mild pain; 4-6 = moderate pain; and 7-10 = severe pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Weekly Mean Pain Scores (Double-Blind Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: Weekly mean pain score was defined as the mean of the daily diary pain ratings split into 7 day intervals. Participants rated their DPN pain over the past 24 hours on an 11-point numeric rating scale ranging from 0 = no pain to 10 = worst possible pain. A rating of 1-3 was considered as mild pain; 4-6 = moderate pain; and 7-10 = severe pain. SB baseline refers to the last 7 pain diary entries up to and including Day 1. DB baseline refers to the last 7 pain diary entries up to and including DB Day 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With At Least 30 Percent and 50 Percent Reduction in Mean Pain Score (Single-Blind Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean pain score was defined as the mean of the last 7 daily diary pain ratings. Participants rated their DPN pain over the past 24 hours on an 11-point numeric rating scale ranging from 0 = no pain to 10 = worst possible pain. A rating of 1-3 was considered as mild pain; 4-6 = moderate pain; and 7-10 = severe pain. Percentage of participants who had at least 30% and 50% pain reduction from SB baseline to Week 6 is reported. SB baseline refers to the last 7 pain diary entries up to and including Day 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With At Least 30 Percent and 50 Percent Reduction in Mean Pain Score (Double-Blind Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: Mean pain score was defined as the mean of the last 7 daily diary pain ratings. Participants rated their DPN pain over the past 24 hours on an 11-point numeric rating scale ranging from 0 = no pain to 10 = worst possible pain. A rating of 1-3 was considered as mild pain; 4-6 = moderate pain; and 7-10 = severe pain. Percentage of participants who had at least 30% and 50% pain reduction from SB baseline to Week 19 is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC) (Single-Blind Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: PGIC: participant rated instrument to measure participant's change in overall status on a 7-point scale; range from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Number of participants in each category are reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC) (Double-Blind Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: PGIC: participant rated instrument to measure participant's change in overall status on a 7-point scale; range from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Number of participants in each category are reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical Outcomes Study -Sleep Scale (MOS-SS) (Single-Blind Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: Participant-rated 12-item questionnaire to assess constructs of sleep over past week; 7 subscales: sleep disturbance (range 0-100), snoring (range 0-100), awaken short of breath (SOB) or with headache (range 0-100), sleep adequacy (range 0-100), somnolence (range: 0-100); sleep quantity (range: 0-24), optimal sleep (yes/no), and 9 item index measures of sleep disturbance provide composite scores: sleep problems index (range 0-100). Except adequacy, optimal sleep and quantity, higher scores=more impairment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical Outcomes Study -Sleep Scale (MOS-SS) (Double-Blind Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: Participant-rated 12-item questionnaire to assess constructs of sleep over past week; 7 subscales: sleep disturbance (range 0-100), snoring (range 0-100), awaken short of breath (SOB) or with headache (range 0-100), sleep adequacy (range 0-100), somnolence (range: 0-100); sleep quantity (range: 0-24), optimal sleep (yes/no), and 9 item index measures of sleep disturbance provide composite scores: sleep problems index (range 0-100). Except adequacy, optimal sleep and quantity, higher scores=more impairment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Optimal Sleep Assessed Using Medical Outcomes Study-Sleep Scale (MOS-SS) (Single-Blind Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: MOS-SS: participant-rated 12 item questionnaire to assess constructs of sleep over past week. It included 7 subscales: sleep disturbance, snoring, awaken short of breath or with headache, sleep adequacy, somnolence, sleep quantity, optimal sleep, and 9 item index measures of sleep disturbance provide composite scores: sleep problems index. Participants responded whether their sleep was optimal or not optimal by choosing yes or no.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Optimal Sleep Assessed Using Medical Outcomes Study-Sleep Scale (MOS-SS) (Double-Blind Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: MOS-SS: participant-rated 12 item questionnaire to assess constructs of sleep over past week. It included 7 subscales: sleep disturbance, snoring, awaken short of breath or with headache, sleep adequacy, somnolence, sleep quantity, optimal sleep, and 9 item index measures of sleep disturbance provide composite scores: sleep problems index. Participants responded whether their sleep was optimal or not optimal by choosing yes or no.

secondary_outcome.measure: Weekly Mean Sleep Interference Score (Single-Blind Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: Weekly mean sleep interference score was defined as the mean of the daily sleep interference diary ratings split into 7 day intervals. Participants rated how painful DPN has interfered with their sleep during the past 24 hours on an 11-point numeric rating scale ranging from 0 = does not interfere with sleep to 10 = completely interferes (unable to sleep due to pain). SB baseline refers to the last 7 pain diary entries up to and including Day 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Weekly Mean Sleep Interference Score (Double-Blind Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: Weekly mean sleep interference score was defined as the mean of the daily sleep interference diary ratings split into 7 day intervals. Participants rated how painful DPN has interfered with their sleep during the past 24 hours on an 11-point numeric rating scale ranging from 0 = does not interfere with sleep to 10 = completely interferes (unable to sleep due to pain).

secondary_outcome.measure: Endpoint Mean Sleep Interference Score (Single-Blind Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: Endpoint mean sleep interference score was defined as the mean of the last 7 sleep interference diaries while receiving SB treatment. Participants rated how painful DPN has interfered with their sleep during the past 24 hours on an 11-point numeric rating scale ranging from 0 = does not interfere to 10 = completely interferes (unable to sleep due to pain).

secondary_outcome.measure: Endpoint Mean Sleep Interference Score (Double-Blind Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: Endpoint mean sleep interference score was defined as the mean of the last 7 sleep interference diaries while receiving DB treatment. Participants rated how painful DPN has interfered with their sleep during the past 24 hours on an 11-point numeric rating scale ranging from 0 = does not interfere to 10 = completely interferes (unable to sleep due to pain).

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life Questionnaire- Diabetic Neuropathy (QOL-DN) (Single-Blind Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: QOL-DN: 35-item participant-rated questionnaire used to assess impact of diabetic neuropathy on the quality of life of participants with diabetic neuropathy. Consists of 5 domains: Physical functioning(Ph Fn)/large fiber (sum of item 8, 11, 13-15, 24, 27-35; range -4 to 56); Activities of daily living (sum of item 12, 22, 23, 25, 26; range 0 to 20); Symptoms (sum of item 1-7, 9; range 0 to 32); Small fiber (sum of item 10, 16, 17, 18; range 0 to 16); Autonomic (sum of item 19, 20, 21; range 0 to 12) and total QOL score (sum of items 1-35) range: -4 to 136. Higher score implied worse QOL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of Life Questionnaire- Diabetic Neuropathy (QOL-DN) (Double-Blind Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: QOL-DN: 35-item participant-rated questionnaire used to assess impact of diabetic neuropathy on the quality of life of participants with diabetic neuropathy. Consists of 5 domains: Physical functioning(Ph Fn)/large fiber (sum of item 8, 11, 13-15, 24, 27-35; range -4 to 56); Activities of daily living (sum of item 12, 22, 23, 25, 26; range 0 to 20); Symptoms (sum of item 1-7, 9; range 0 to 32); Small fiber (sum of item 10, 16, 17, 18; range 0 to 16); Autonomic (sum of item 19, 20, 21; range 0 to 12) and total QOL score (sum of items 1-35) range: -4 to 136. Higher score implied worse QOL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Visual Analog Scale (VAS) (Single-Blind Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants rated their pain on a 100 millimeter (mm) Visual Analog Scale (VAS) ranging from 0 mm = no pain to 100 mm = worst possible pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain Visual Analog Scale (VAS) (Double-Blind Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants rated their pain on a 100 millimeter (mm) Visual Analog Scale (VAS) ranging from 0 mm = no pain to 100 mm = worst possible pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Brief Pain Inventory-Short Form (BPI-sf) (Single-Blind Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: BPI-sf: self-administered questionnaire developed to assess severity, impact of pain on daily functions, consisted of 5 questions. Questions 1-4 measured the severity of pain based on pain experienced over the past 24-hours on an 11-point scale ranged from 0 (no pain) to10 (worst possible pain). Question 5: 7 item subsets that measured level of interference of pain on daily functions on an 11-point scale ranged from 0 (does not interfere) to 10 (completely interferes).

secondary_outcome.measure: Brief Pain Inventory-Short Form (BPI-sf) (Double-Blind Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: BPI-sf: self-administered questionnaire developed to assess severity, impact of pain on daily functions, consisted of 5 questions. Questions 1-4 measured the severity of pain based on pain experienced over the past 24-hours on an 11-point scale ranged from 0 (no pain) to10 (worst possible pain). Question 5: 7 item subsets that measured level of interference of pain on daily functions on an 11-point scale ranged from 0 (does not interfere) to 10 (completely interferes).

secondary_outcome.measure: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) (Single-Blind Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: HADS: self-administered questionnaire, consists of 2 sub-scales; measuring anxiety (HADS-A), and depression (HADS-D). Each sub-scale consists of 7 items on which participants responded as to how each item applies to them on a 4-point scale ranging from 0 (no anxiety or depression) to 3 (severe feeling of anxiety or depression). Total score range for each sub-scale = 0 to 21, where higher score indicates more severe anxiety or depression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) (Double-Blind Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: HADS: self-administered questionnaire, consists of 2 sub-scales; measuring anxiety (HADS-A), and depression (HADS-D). Each sub-scale consists of 7 items on which participants responded as to how each item applies to them on a 4-point scale ranging from 0 (no anxiety or depression) to 3 (severe feeling of anxiety or depression). Total score range for each sub-scale = 0 to 21, where higher score indicates more severe anxiety or depression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Global Evaluation of Study Medication (GESM) (Single-Blind Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: GESM: single-item, self-administered treatment satisfaction questionnaire. Participants answered "how would you rate the study medication you received for pain?" on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very satisfied) to 7 (very dissatisfied). Number of participants in each category are reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient Global Evaluation of Study Medication (GESM) (Double-Blind Phase)
secondary_outcome.description: GESM: single-item, self-administered treatment satisfaction questionnaire. Participants answered "how would you rate the study medication you received for pain?" on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very satisfied) to 7 (very dissatisfied). Number of participants in each category are reported.

intervention.description: Lyrica 150-300 mg/day. Medication is supplied as capsules and given 3 times daily.
Placebo is supplied as capsules and given 3 times daily.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients must have painful diabetic peripheral neuropathy and be receiving treatment for this condition.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with other pain conditions cannot participate.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Pregabalin SB
group.description: Participants who were inadequately controlled on their current diabetic peripheral neuropathy (DPN) treatment were switched to single-blind (SB) pregabalin capsules at a starting dose of 150 milligram per day (mg/day) and increased to 300 mg/day, administered three times daily up to Week 6. Participants who experienced greater than or equal to (>=) 30 percent (%) pain reduction from baseline to Week 6 were eligible for double-blind (DB) treatment phase.

group.title: Pregabalin DB
group.description: Participants who experienced >=30% pain reduction in SB treatment phase, after Week 6 received pregabalin capsules 150 mg/day or 300 mg/day, administered three times daily up to Week 19 during DB treatment phase.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants who experienced >=30% pain reduction in SB treatment phase, after Week 6 received matching placebo capsules, administered three times daily up to Week 19 during DB treatment phase.

group.title: Pregabalin SB
group.description: Participants who were inadequately controlled on their current DPN treatment were switched to SB pregabalin capsules at a starting dose of 150 mg/day and increased to 300 mg/day, administered three times daily up to Week 6. Participants who experienced >=30% pain reduction from baseline to Week 6 were eligible for DB treatment phase.

Gender

outcome.title: Change From Single-Blind Baseline in Mean Pain Score at Week 19 During Double-Blind Phase
outcome.description: Mean pain score was defined as the mean of the last 7 daily diary pain ratings. Participants rated their DPN pain over the past 24 hours on an 11-point numeric rating scale ranging from 0 = no pain to 10 = worst possible pain. A rating of 1-3 was considered as mild pain; 4-6 = moderate pain; and 7-10 = severe pain. SB baseline refers to the last 7 pain diary entries up to and including Day 1.
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS) included all participants randomized to double-blind treatment who received at least 1 dose of double-blind study treatment. Missing data were imputed using Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF).

measure.title: Change From Single-Blind Baseline in Mean Pain Score at Week 19 During Double-Blind Phase
measure.description: Mean pain score was defined as the mean of the last 7 daily diary pain ratings. Participants rated their DPN pain over the past 24 hours on an 11-point numeric rating scale ranging from 0 = no pain to 10 = worst possible pain. A rating of 1-3 was considered as mild pain; 4-6 = moderate pain; and 7-10 = severe pain. SB baseline refers to the last 7 pain diary entries up to and including Day 1.
measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS) included all participants randomized to double-blind treatment who received at least 1 dose of double-blind study treatment. Missing data were imputed using Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF).

analysis.groups_desc: P-value was calculated using analysis of covariance (ANCOVA), with terms for baseline mean pain score, center and treatment in the model.

outcome.title: Time to Loss of Pain Response (Double-Blind Phase)
outcome.description: Time to loss of pain response (based on the daily pain diary data) during the DB treatment phase was analyzed using survival analysis technique. Loss of pain response was defined as less than (<) 15% pain response relative to the SB baseline. SB baseline refers to the last 7 pain diary entries up to and including Day 1.
outcome.population: FAS included all participants randomized to double-blind treatment who received at least 1 dose of double-blind study treatment.

group.title: Pregabalin DB
group.description: Participants who experienced >=30% pain reduction in SB treatment phase, after Week 6 received pregabalin capsules 150 mg/day or 300 mg/day, administered three times daily up to Week 19 during DB treatment phase.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants who experienced >=30% pain reduction in SB treatment phase, after Week 6 received matching placebo capsules, administered three times daily up to Week 19 during DB treatment phase.

measure.title: Time to Loss of Pain Response (Double-Blind Phase)
measure.description: Time to loss of pain response (based on the daily pain diary data) during the DB treatment phase was analyzed using survival analysis technique. Loss of pain response was defined as less than (<) 15% pain response relative to the SB baseline. SB baseline refers to the last 7 pain diary entries up to and including Day 1.
measure.population: FAS included all participants randomized to double-blind treatment who received at least 1 dose of double-blind study treatment.

measurement_list.measurement: Median and 95% confidence interval (CI) were not estimable because less than 50% participants experienced loss of pain response.
Median and 95% confidence interval (CI) were not estimable because less than 50% participants experienced loss of pain response.

outcome.title: Change From Single-Blind Baseline in Mean Pain Score at Week 6 During Single-Blind Phase
outcome.description: Mean pain score was defined as the mean of the last 7 daily diary pain ratings. Participants rated their DPN pain over the past 24 hours on an 11-point numeric rating scale ranging from 0 = no pain to 10 = worst possible pain. A rating of 1-3 was considered as mild pain; 4-6 = moderate pain; and 7-10 = severe pain. SB baseline refers to the last 7 pain diary entries up to and including Day 1.
outcome.population: Single-Blind Analysis Set (SBAS) included all participants who were enrolled in single-blind treatment phase and received at least 1 dose of study treatment. N (number of participants analyzed): participants who were evaluable for this measure and n: participants who were evaluable for specified time-point. Missing data were imputed using LOCF.

outcome.description: PGIC: participant rated instrument to measure participant's change in overall status on a 7-point scale; range from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Number of participants in each category are reported.
outcome.population: FAS included all participants randomized to double-blind treatment who received at least 1 dose of double-blind study treatment. Here N (number of participants analyzed) signifies participants who were evaluable for this measure.

group.title: Pregabalin DB
group.description: Participants who experienced >=30% pain reduction in SB treatment phase, after Week 6 received pregabalin capsules 150 mg/day or 300 mg/day, administered three times daily up to Week 19 during DB treatment phase.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants who experienced >=30% pain reduction in SB treatment phase, after Week 6 received matching placebo capsules, administered three times daily up to Week 19 during DB treatment phase.

measure.title: Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC) (Double-Blind Phase)
measure.description: PGIC: participant rated instrument to measure participant's change in overall status on a 7-point scale; range from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Number of participants in each category are reported.
measure.population: FAS included all participants randomized to double-blind treatment who received at least 1 dose of double-blind study treatment. Here N (number of participants analyzed) signifies participants who were evaluable for this measure.

outcome.title: Medical Outcomes Study -Sleep Scale (MOS-SS) (Single-Blind Phase)
outcome.description: Participant-rated 12-item questionnaire to assess constructs of sleep over past week; 7 subscales: sleep disturbance (range 0-100), snoring (range 0-100), awaken short of breath (SOB) or with headache (range 0-100), sleep adequacy (range 0-100), somnolence (range: 0-100); sleep quantity (range: 0-24), optimal sleep (yes/no), and 9 item index measures of sleep disturbance provide composite scores: sleep problems index (range 0-100). Except adequacy, optimal sleep and quantity, higher scores=more impairment.
outcome.population: SBAS included all participants who were enrolled into the single-blind treatment phase and received at least one dose of study medication. Here n signifies participants who were evaluable for specified time-point.

group.title: Pregabalin SB
group.description: Participants who were inadequately controlled on their current DPN treatment were switched to SB pregabalin capsules at a starting dose of 150 mg/day and increased to 300 mg/day, administered three times daily up to Week 6. Participants who experienced >=30% pain reduction from baseline to Week 6 were eligible for DB treatment phase.

measure.title: Medical Outcomes Study -Sleep Scale (MOS-SS) (Single-Blind Phase)
measure.description: Participant-rated 12-item questionnaire to assess constructs of sleep over past week; 7 subscales: sleep disturbance (range 0-100), snoring (range 0-100), awaken short of breath (SOB) or with headache (range 0-100), sleep adequacy (range 0-100), somnolence (range: 0-100); sleep quantity (range: 0-24), optimal sleep (yes/no), and 9 item index measures of sleep disturbance provide composite scores: sleep problems index (range 0-100). Except adequacy, optimal sleep and quantity, higher scores=more impairment.
measure.population: SBAS included all participants who were enrolled into the single-blind treatment phase and received at least one dose of study medication. Here n signifies participants who were evaluable for specified time-point.

Except adequacy, optimal sleep and quantity, higher scores=more impairment.

group.title: Placebo

measure.title: Medical Outcomes Study -Sleep Scale (MOS-SS) (Double-Blind Phase)
measure.description: Participant-rated 12-item questionnaire to assess constructs of sleep over past week; 7 subscales: sleep disturbance (range 0-100), snoring (range 0-100), awaken short of breath (SOB) or with headache (range 0-100), sleep adequacy (range 0-100), somnolence (range: 0-100); sleep quantity (range: 0-24), optimal sleep (yes/no), and 9 item index measures of sleep disturbance provide composite scores: sleep problems index (range 0-100). Except adequacy, optimal sleep and quantity, higher scores=more impairment.
measure.population: FAS included all participants randomized to double-blind treatment who received at least 1 dose of double-blind study treatment. Here N (number of participants analyzed) signifies participants who were evaluable for this measure.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Optimal Sleep Assessed Using Medical Outcomes Study-Sleep Scale (MOS-SS) (Single-Blind Phase)
outcome.description: MOS-SS: participant-rated 12 item questionnaire to assess constructs of sleep over past week. It included 7 subscales: sleep disturbance, snoring, awaken short of breath or with headache, sleep adequacy, somnolence, sleep quantity, optimal sleep, and 9 item index measures of sleep disturbance provide composite scores: sleep problems index. Participants responded whether their sleep was optimal or not optimal by choosing yes or no.
outcome.population: SBAS included all participants who were enrolled into the single-blind treatment phase and received at least one dose of study medication.

group.title: Pregabalin SB
group.description: Participants who were inadequately controlled on their current DPN treatment were switched to SB pregabalin capsules at a starting dose of 150 mg/day and increased to 300 mg/day, administered three times daily up to Week 6. Participants who experienced >=30% pain reduction from baseline to Week 6 were eligible for DB treatment phase.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Optimal Sleep Assessed Using Medical Outcomes Study-Sleep Scale (MOS-SS) (Single-Blind Phase)
measure.description: MOS-SS: participant-rated 12 item questionnaire to assess constructs of sleep over past week. It included 7 subscales: sleep disturbance, snoring, awaken short of breath or with headache, sleep adequacy, somnolence, sleep quantity, optimal sleep, and 9 item index measures of sleep disturbance provide composite scores: sleep problems index. Participants responded whether their sleep was optimal or not optimal by choosing yes or no.
measure.population: SBAS included all participants who were enrolled into the single-blind treatment phase and received at least one dose of study medication.

outcome.description: MOS-SS: participant-rated 12 item questionnaire to assess constructs of sleep over past week. It included 7 subscales: sleep disturbance, snoring, awaken short of breath or with headache, sleep adequacy, somnolence, sleep quantity, optimal sleep, and 9 item index measures of sleep disturbance provide composite scores: sleep problems index. Participants responded whether their sleep was optimal or not optimal by choosing yes or no.

group.title: Pregabalin DB
group.description: Participants who experienced >=30% pain reduction in SB treatment phase, after Week 6 received pregabalin capsules 150 mg/day or 300 mg/day, administered three times daily up to Week 19 during DB treatment phase.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants who experienced >=30% pain reduction in SB treatment phase, after Week 6 received matching placebo capsules, administered three times daily up to Week 19 during DB treatment phase.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Optimal Sleep Assessed Using Medical Outcomes Study-Sleep Scale (MOS-SS) (Double-Blind Phase)
measure.description: MOS-SS: participant-rated 12 item questionnaire to assess constructs of sleep over past week. It included 7 subscales: sleep disturbance, snoring, awaken short of breath or with headache, sleep adequacy, somnolence, sleep quantity, optimal sleep, and 9 item index measures of sleep disturbance provide composite scores: sleep problems index. Participants responded whether their sleep was optimal or not optimal by choosing yes or no.
measure.population: FAS included all participants randomized to double-blind treatment who received at least 1 dose of double-blind study treatment.

outcome.title: Weekly Mean Sleep Interference Score (Single-Blind Phase)
outcome.description: Weekly mean sleep interference score was defined as the mean of the daily sleep interference diary ratings split into 7 day intervals. Participants rated how painful DPN has interfered with their sleep during the past 24 hours on an 11-point numeric rating scale ranging from 0 = does not interfere with sleep to 10 = completely interferes (unable to sleep due to pain). SB baseline refers to the last 7 pain diary entries up to and including Day 1.
outcome.population: SBAS included all participants who were enrolled into the single-blind treatment phase and received at least 1 dose of study treatment. Here N (number of participants analyzed) signifies participants who were evaluable for this measure and n signifies participants who were evaluable for specified time point.

group.title: Pregabalin SB
group.description: Participants who were inadequately controlled on their current DPN treatment were switched to SB pregabalin capsules at a starting dose of 150 mg/day and increased to 300 mg/day, administered three times daily up to Week 6. Participants who experienced >=30% pain reduction from baseline to Week 6 were eligible for DB treatment phase.

measure.title: Weekly Mean Sleep Interference Score (Single-Blind Phase)
measure.description: Weekly mean sleep interference score was defined as the mean of the daily sleep interference diary ratings split into 7 day intervals. Participants rated how painful DPN has interfered with their sleep during the past 24 hours on an 11-point numeric rating scale ranging from 0 = does not interfere with sleep to 10 = completely interferes (unable to sleep due to pain). SB baseline refers to the last 7 pain diary entries up to and including Day 1.
measure.population: SBAS included all participants who were enrolled into the single-blind treatment phase and received at least 1 dose of study treatment. Here N (number of participants analyzed) signifies participants who were evaluable for this measure and n signifies participants who were evaluable for specified time point.

outcome.title: Weekly Mean Sleep Interference Score (Double-Blind Phase)
outcome.description: Weekly mean sleep interference score was defined as the mean of the daily sleep interference diary ratings split into 7 day intervals. Participants rated how painful DPN has interfered with their sleep during the past 24 hours on an 11-point numeric rating scale ranging from 0 = does not interfere with sleep to 10 = completely interferes (unable to sleep due to pain).
outcome.population: FAS included all participants randomized to double-blind treatment who received at least 1 dose of double-blind study treatment. Here n signifies participants who were evaluable for specified time-point for each arm group, respectively.

group.title: Pregabalin DB
group.description: Participants who experienced >=30% pain reduction in SB treatment phase, after Week 6 received pregabalin capsules 150 mg/day or 300 mg/day, administered three times daily up to Week 19 during DB treatment phase.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants who experienced >=30% pain reduction in SB treatment phase, after Week 6 received matching placebo capsules, administered three times daily up to Week 19 during DB treatment phase.

measure.title: Weekly Mean Sleep Interference Score (Double-Blind Phase)
measure.description: Weekly mean sleep interference score was defined as the mean of the daily sleep interference diary ratings split into 7 day intervals. Participants rated how painful DPN has interfered with their sleep during the past 24 hours on an 11-point numeric rating scale ranging from 0 = does not interfere with sleep to 10 = completely interferes (unable to sleep due to pain).
measure.population: FAS included all participants randomized to double-blind treatment who received at least 1 dose of double-blind study treatment. Here n signifies participants who were evaluable for specified time-point for each arm group, respectively.

outcome.title: Endpoint Mean Sleep Interference Score (Single-Blind Phase)
outcome.description: Endpoint mean sleep interference score was defined as the mean of the last 7 sleep interference diaries while receiving SB treatment. Participants rated how painful DPN has interfered with their sleep during the past 24 hours on an 11-point numeric rating scale ranging from 0 = does not interfere to 10 = completely interferes (unable to sleep due to pain).
outcome.population: SBAS included all participants who were enrolled into the single-blind treatment phase and received at least 1 dose of study treatment. Missing data were imputed using LOCF. Here N (number of participants analyzed) signifies participants who were evaluable for this measure.

group.title: Pregabalin SB
group.description: Participants who were inadequately controlled on their current DPN treatment were switched to SB pregabalin capsules at a starting dose of 150 mg/day and increased to 300 mg/day, administered three times daily up to Week 6. Participants who experienced >=30% pain reduction from baseline to Week 6 were eligible for DB treatment phase.

measure.title: Endpoint Mean Sleep Interference Score (Single-Blind Phase)
measure.description: Endpoint mean sleep interference score was defined as the mean of the last 7 sleep interference diaries while receiving SB treatment. Participants rated how painful DPN has interfered with their sleep during the past 24 hours on an 11-point numeric rating scale ranging from 0 = does not interfere to 10 = completely interferes (unable to sleep due to pain).
measure.population: SBAS included all participants who were enrolled into the single-blind treatment phase and received at least 1 dose of study treatment. Missing data were imputed using LOCF. Here N (number of participants analyzed) signifies participants who were evaluable for this measure.

outcome.title: Endpoint Mean Sleep Interference Score (Double-Blind Phase)
outcome.description: Endpoint mean sleep interference score was defined as the mean of the last 7 sleep interference diaries while receiving DB treatment. Participants rated how painful DPN has interfered with their sleep during the past 24 hours on an 11-point numeric rating scale ranging from 0 = does not interfere to 10 = completely interferes (unable to sleep due to pain).
outcome.population: FAS included all participants randomized to double-blind treatment who received at least 1 dose of double-blind study treatment. Missing data were imputed using LOCF. Here N (number of participants analyzed) signifies participants who were evaluable for this measure.

group.title: Pregabalin DB
group.description: Participants who experienced >=30% pain reduction in SB treatment phase, after Week 6 received pregabalin capsules 150 mg/day or 300 mg/day, administered three times daily up to Week 19 during DB treatment phase.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants who experienced >=30% pain reduction in SB treatment phase, after Week 6 received matching placebo capsules, administered three times daily up to Week 19 during DB treatment phase.

measure.title: Endpoint Mean Sleep Interference Score (Double-Blind Phase)
measure.description: Endpoint mean sleep interference score was defined as the mean of the last 7 sleep interference diaries while receiving DB treatment. Participants rated how painful DPN has interfered with their sleep during the past 24 hours on an 11-point numeric rating scale ranging from 0 = does not interfere to 10 = completely interferes (unable to sleep due to pain).
measure.population: FAS included all participants randomized to double-blind treatment who received at least 1 dose of double-blind study treatment. Missing data were imputed using LOCF. Here N (number of participants analyzed) signifies participants who were evaluable for this measure.

outcome.title: Quality of Life Questionnaire Diabetic Neuropathy (QOL-DN) (Single-Blind Phase)
outcome.description: QOL-DN: 35-item participant-rated questionnaire used to assess impact of diabetic neuropathy on the quality of life of participants with diabetic neuropathy. Consists of 5 domains: Physical functioning(Ph Fn)/large fiber (sum of item 8, 11, 13-15, 24, 27-35; range -4 to 56); Activities of daily living (sum of item 12, 22, 23, 25, 26; range 0 to 20); Symptoms (sum of item 1-7, 9; range 0 to 32); Small fiber (sum of item 10, 16, 17, 18; range 0 to 16); Autonomic (sum of item 19, 20, 21; range 0 to 12) and total QOL score (sum of items 1-35) range: -4 to 136. Higher score implied worse QOL.
outcome.population: SBAS included all participants who were enrolled into the single-blind treatment phase and received at least 1 dose of study treatment. Here n signifies participants who were evaluable for specified time point.

group.title: Pregabalin SB
group.description: Participants who were inadequately controlled on their current DPN treatment were switched to SB pregabalin capsules at a starting dose of 150 mg/day and increased to 300 mg/day, administered three times daily up to Week 6. Participants who experienced >=30% pain reduction from baseline to Week 6 were eligible for DB treatment phase.

measure.description: QOL-DN: 35-item participant-rated questionnaire used to assess impact of diabetic neuropathy on the quality of life of participants with diabetic neuropathy. Higher score implied worse QOL.
measure.population: SBAS included all participants who were enrolled into the single-blind treatment phase and received at least 1 dose of study treatment. Here n signifies participants who were evaluable for specified time point.

outcome.title: Pain Visual Analog Scale (VAS) (Single-Blind Phase)
outcome.description: Participants rated their pain on a 100 millimeter (mm) Visual Analog Scale (VAS) ranging from 0 mm = no pain to 100 mm = worst possible pain.
outcome.population: SBAS included all participants who were enrolled into the single-blind treatment phase and received at least 1 dose of study treatment. Here n signifies participants who were evaluable for specified time-point.

group.title: Pregabalin SB
group.description: Participants who were inadequately controlled on their current DPN treatment were switched to SB pregabalin capsules at a starting dose of 150 mg/day and increased to 300 mg/day, administered three times daily up to Week 6. Participants who experienced >=30% pain reduction from baseline to Week 6 were eligible for DB treatment phase.

measure.title: Pain Visual Analog Scale (VAS) (Double-Blind Phase)
measure.description: Participants rated their pain on a 100 millimeter (mm) Visual Analog Scale (VAS) ranging from 0 mm = no pain to 100 mm = worst possible pain.

outcome.title: Brief Pain Inventory-Short Form (BPI-sf) (Single-Blind Phase)
outcome.description: BPI-sf: self-administered questionnaire developed to assess severity, impact of pain on daily functions, consisted of 5 questions. Questions 1-4 measured the severity of pain based on pain experienced over the past 24-hours on an 11-point scale ranged from 0 (no pain) to10 (worst possible pain). Question 5: 7 item subsets that measured level of interference of pain on daily functions on an 11-point scale ranged from 0 (does not interfere) to 10 (completely interferes).
outcome.population: SBAS included all participants who were enrolled into the single-blind treatment phase and received at least 1 dose of study treatment. Here n signifies participants who were evaluable for specified time-point.

group.title: Pregabalin SB
group.description: Participants who were inadequately controlled on their current DPN treatment were switched to SB pregabalin capsules at a starting dose of 150 mg/day and increased to 300 mg/day, administered three times daily up to Week 6. Participants who experienced >=30% pain reduction from baseline to Week 6 were eligible for DB treatment phase.

measure.description: BPI-sf: self-administered questionnaire developed to assess severity, impact of pain on daily functions, consisted of 5 questions. Questions 1-4 measured the severity of pain based on pain experienced over the past 24-hours on an 11-point scale ranged from 0 (no pain) to10 (worst possible pain). group.title: Placebo

measure.title: Brief Pain Inventory-Short Form (BPI-sf) (Double-Blind Phase)
measure.description: BPI-sf: self-administered questionnaire developed to assess severity, impact of pain on daily functions, consisted of 5 questions. Questions 1-4 measured the severity of pain based on pain experienced over the past 24-hours on an 11-point scale ranged from 0 (no pain) to10 (worst possible pain). outcome.title: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) (Single-Blind Phase)
outcome.description: HADS: self-administered questionnaire, consists of 2 sub-scales; measuring anxiety (HADS-A), and depression (HADS-D). Each sub-scale consists of 7 items on which participants responded as to how each item applies to them on a 4-point scale ranging from 0 (no anxiety or depression) to 3 (severe feeling of anxiety or depression). Total score range for each sub-scale = 0 to 21, where higher score indicates more severe anxiety or depression.
outcome.population: SBAS included all participants who were enrolled into the single-blind treatment phase and received at least 1 dose of study treatment. Here N (number of participants) signifies participants who were evaluable for this measure and n signifies participants who were evaluable for specified time point.

Participants who experienced >=30% pain reduction from baseline to Week 6 were eligible for DB treatment phase.

outcome.title: Patient Global Evaluation of Study Medication (GESM) (Single-Blind Phase)
outcome.description: GESM: single-item, self-administered treatment satisfaction questionnaire. Participants answered how would you rate the study medication you received for pain? on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very satisfied) to 7 (very dissatisfied). Number of participants in each category are reported.
outcome.population: SBAS included all participants who were enrolled into the single-blind treatment phase and received at least 1 dose of study treatment. Here "N" (number of participants analyzed) signifies participants who were evaluable for this measure.

group.title: Pregabalin SB
group.description: Participants who were inadequately controlled on their current DPN treatment were switched to SB pregabalin capsules at a starting dose of 150 mg/day and increased to 300 mg/day, administered three times daily up to Week 6. Participants who experienced >=30% pain reduction from baseline to Week 6 were eligible for DB treatment phase.

Number of participants in each category are reported.
measure.population: SBAS included all participants who were enrolled into the single-blind treatment phase and received at least 1 dose of study treatment. Here "N" (number of participants analyzed) signifies participants who were evaluable for this measure.

outcome.title: Patient Global Evaluation of Study Medication (GESM) (Double-Blind Phase)
outcome.description: GESM: single-item, self-administered treatment satisfaction questionnaire. Participants answered how would you rate the study medication you received for pain? on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very satisfied) to 7 (very dissatisfied). Number of participants in each category are reported.
outcome.population: FAS included all participants randomized to double-blind treatment who received at least 1 dose of double-blind study treatment. Here "N" (number of participants analyzed) signifies participants who were evaluable for this measure.

group.title: Pregabalin DB
group.description: Participants who experienced >=30% pain reduction in SB treatment phase, after Week 6 received pregabalin capsules 150 mg/day or 300 mg/day, administered three times daily up to Week 19 during DB treatment phase.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants who experienced >=30% pain reduction in SB treatment phase, after Week 6 received matching placebo capsules, administered three times daily up to Week 19 during DB treatment phase.

measure.title: Patient Global Evaluation of Study Medication (GESM) (Double-Blind Phase)
measure.description: GESM: single-item, self-administered treatment satisfaction questionnaire. Participants answered how would you rate the study medication you received for pain? on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very satisfied) to 7 (very dissatisfied). Number of participants in each category are reported.
measure.population: FAS included all participants randomized to double-blind treatment who received at least 1 dose of double-blind study treatment. Here "N" (number of participants analyzed) signifies participants who were evaluable for this measure.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Pregabalin SB
group.description: Participants who were inadequately controlled on their current DPN treatment were switched to SB pregabalin capsules at a starting dose of 150 mg/day and increased to 300 mg/day, administered three times daily up to Week 6. Participants who experienced >=30% pain reduction from baseline to Week 6 were eligible for DB treatment phase.

group.title: Pregabalin DB
group.description: Participants who experienced >=30% pain reduction in SB treatment phase, after Week 6 received pregabalin capsules 150 mg/day or 300 mg/day, administered three times daily up to Week 19 during DB treatment phase.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants who experienced >=30% pain reduction in SB treatment phase, after Week 6 received matching placebo capsules, administered three times daily up to Week 19 during DB treatment phase.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
